meanings.definition: To argue or dispute angrily or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The siblings were wrangling over who gets to sit in the front seat of the car.
meanings.sent2: The politicians were wrangling over the new law in the parliament.
meanings.sent3: The kids were wrangling over the last piece of cake at the party.
meanings.sent4: The team was wrangling with the coach about the game strategy.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors were wrangling loudly about the property line.

meanings.definition: To round up, herd, or manage livestock.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy was wrangling the cattle back to the barn.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd was wrangling the sheep into the pen for the night.
meanings.sent3: The farmer was wrangling the chickens into their coop before sunset.
meanings.sent4: The rancher was wrangling the horses into the stable for feeding.
meanings.sent5: The wrangler was wrangling the herd of horses on the open range.

meanings.definition: A dispute or argument, especially one that is prolonged or bitter.
meanings.sent1: The family had a wrangling over the inheritance that lasted for months.
meanings.sent2: The legal team was caught in a wrangling over the contract terms.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show had a hilarious skit about a never-ending wrangling between friends.
meanings.sent4: The novel depicted a political wrangling that shaped the fate of the nation.
meanings.sent5: The historical documentary highlighted the intense wrangling among the leaders during the war.
